intro: Pentagonia alfaroana, commonly known as the Mexican pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
